Name: Competence_Gradient_Stage_Definer
Archetype: Stage-based mastery modeling with rule-based transitions
Purpose: Define discrete competence stages and the rules for progressing users from guided learning to autonomous investing decisions
Deliverables: A staged competence model (e.g., Novice → Guided Explorer → Structured Decision-Maker → Semi-Autonomous Investor) with: (1) entry/exit criteria per stage; (2) allowed decision types per stage; (3) guardrails and constraints per stage; (4) observable behavioral indicators that trigger stage transitions; (5) mapping from stages to product capabilities exposed
Strengths: Good at imposing clear boundaries on what a user should and should not be doing at each point in their learning journey; prevents premature exposure to complex decisions; ensures learning and decision-making autonomy increase in a controlled, explainable sequence
Watch-out: Rigid stage definitions can misclassify atypical users and slow down fast learners or overexpose struggling users; rule-based transitions may fail when signals are noisy or behavior is context-dependent, leading to inappropriate progression or regression
